content.description:
Climb up the left side of a small detached pillar at the bottom of the black streak to the right of

The Flue

.  Make tough moves to gain the shallow, right-leaning dihedral, plug gear where needed to get through to the top of the corner, and gain the last 2 bolts prior to reaching the 2 bolt anchor.
content.protection: 2 bolts at the start, multiple finger and smaller size pieces in the dihedral, 2 bolts on the finishing stretch to the 2 bolt anchor.  The gear after pulling into the dihedral could be tough to place on lead.
content.location: This is the third route from the left on Middle Class Wall proper.

content.description:
Start in a corner, making moves that have an alpine trad feel. After establishing on the detached block on the right, move into a thinner crack above laybacking using scummy feet. Dispatch the crux at the fourth bolt using tricky footwork, then cruise to the anchors.

This route was not in the guidebook or previously listed in MP, so I gave it a name and assigned it a grade that I thought was fair. The bolts look relatively new, but I don't have any information on when this climb was put up or the FA party. Consensus will probably come out to somewhere around 10d/11a.
content.location:
Black hangers mark this route on the far left side of the wall around the corner about 50 feet from

Git Wood

.

content.description: This is the furthest climb on the left. The route climbs the tan streak past 4 bolts. Continuous fun movement between small jugs and sidepulls gets you to the sloping ledge at the top.
This has fun movement between big jugs and sidepulls. The crux comes at the second bolt.
content.location: It is the second route from left.

content.description:
Follow the right-angling ramp up to the high first bolt. If you slip going to the first bolt, it's going to be a very bad day for both the belayer and the climber. The climbing is easy if you are solid on this grade, but you're pretty much smearing going to the first bolt on the ramp.

This is a fun technical route that will work on your foot work and your ability to stem properly. The route gets steeper once you leave the ramp which serves as a decent warmup before heading up to the upper tiers.
content.protection: 4 bolts + chain anchors (currently there are NO rap rings). It is highly recommended that you rappel from this route.
content.location: This is the furthest route on the right side of the Chimney Sweep Wall.
